p: This was a 35-year-old woman, with history of SCA, 28 weeks pregnant. Her prior history was acute chest syndrome (ACS) in 2012, pulmonary thromboembolism in 2017 with pulmonary hypertension (estimated PASP 47Â mmHg), leg ulcers in 2012 and 2 previous pregnancies (the last one in 2017, complicated with preeclampsia). She had received the influenza vaccine on April 2, 2020.
